intro: Mammillaria karwinskiana var. centrispina, commonly known as the Centrispina mammillaria, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its globular shape and dense covering of white to pale yellow spines. The plant typically grows to a height of 5–10 centimeters and features a ribbed stem with areoles that bear both spines and flowers. Its flowers are usually pink or reddish, opening in spring or early summer. This variety is well-suited for rock gardens and requires well-draining soil and minimal water.
